alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 02 at 12:47PM PST until January 05 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING ABOVE 5000 FEET. * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches above 3000 ft, 5 to 9 inches above 5000 ft. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches above 5000 ft, 20 to 40 inches above 6000 ft. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 4 AM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
